title: Peter Mandelson unlikely to retain Labour whip if he returns to Lords, senior peer says – UK politics live
summary: Lord Foulkes reacted to Harriet Harman's proposal to ban Peter Mandelson from the House of Lords. He defended Mandelson's contributions and criticized the idea of exclusion. The debate highlights ongoing tensions regarding peerage and accountability in the House of Lords.

title: Israel army says it will use ‘unprecedented force’ in Gaza City and urges residents to leave – Middle East crisis live
summary: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) have urged residents of Gaza City to evacuate south for safety. However, they simultaneously closed the Sala al-Din road, which was a key evacuation route. This closure complicates the evacuation efforts for civilians seeking refuge from ongoing conflict.

title: World Athletics Championships 2025: Noah Lyles takes men’s 200m gold, Benjamin and Bol win 400m hurdles – live
summary: Yara El-Shaboury provides updates from Tokyo on the seventh night of events. The highlights include the highly anticipated men’s and women’s 200m finals. Fans can look forward to thrilling performances from top athletes.

title: Congress prepares to vote on short-term funding bill to avert US government shutdown – live updates
summary: The Republican bill aims to fund the government until November 21. House GOP leadership is optimistic about garnering enough support for its passage. Meanwhile, Democrats are expected to vote against the measure.

title: Maresca short on Sterling sympathy, Arsenal make boardroom reshuffle: football – live
summary: Join our writers for updates and insights into the latest news as we head into the weekend. Expect previews and thoughtful commentary on current events. Stay informed and engaged with the most relevant topics.
